body:
大牛，python 的包安装能否再详细一点。  因为用的是 IPython notebook开发。
因此 环境的python 和notebook的环境不同。
http://mxnet.readthedocs.org/en/latest/build.html#python-package-installation
Dropout has been added in blacklist, I think you need to add cudnn bn here https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/src/symbol/static_graph.cc#L255
Also mention the advanced mode is still experimental and disabled by default

@zhangchen-qinyinghua 
Any class or function _not_ guarded by MXNET_API will not be exported in the DLL. So if you try to use it, you get undefined symbol. For example, Executor::Bind(), and xxx::Create() functions are not exported by default.

By using MXNET_API, we can fix the undefined symbol problem, but then we face the class layout problem. Different compiler/compiler options results in different class layout, thus calling C++ API from dynamic library is a bad idea. This is also a problem for Linux, if you use GCC -O2 to compile the .so file, and then use GCC -O0 to compile mlp.

The only safe way to use dynamic library is to use only C api, which is well defined and compatible across different compilers. I have just started writing a C++ wrapper on top of the C API(https://github.com/hjk41/mxnet/blob/cpp/example/cpp/MxNetCpp.h). Maybe we can work together on the wrapper. And we probably should setup a standalone project as we did for MxNet.jl.

You can use getinternals to retrieve the internals of a symbol, see last block of the notebook
https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/example/notebooks/predict-with-pretrained-model.ipynb

how many epoch you trained the model?
can you train inception model first?
@FBracun I think I can fix this now. Can you share your code? So I can test and maybe add as an example.

1. i suggest to use 512 for two gpus for better system performance. but if your problem is tiny, you probably need to reduce this number for better convergence
2. if you use codes in `example/image-classification`, it will produce xxx samples/sec for every 50 or 100 batches. if you find that number dosn't change from time to time (often not), then you can use it
LGTM
let us go for plugin then

how about when do the backward(), fix in_grad = 0,then it will not infuence the bottom layer?
another, becasue this evaluation is only used forward, can let NDArray support this compution on gpu?

the error message here is not about the train_Y, but about the train_X; because during convolution computation, it does't need the label(only the output layer will used label).
in`train_X = train_X.reshape((len(train_X), 28, 28))`, train_X is only three dim right now, 
you may need to change it like this `train_X = train_X.reshape((len(train_X), 1, 28, 28))`

you may need more description about your task/data.
but the general step is, firstly convert .mat to numpy array( maybe scipy.io can do it), if your data is not big enough, then rearrange to some LSTM network depend on your task style, the data style or lstm model can refer to:https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/example/rnn/lstm_ptb.py#L16-L35

I ended up doing it with imperative API. In the process I refactored FeedForward model to directly send GPU output to metric without copying to cpu. I think this is a better interface because this allows metric to be computed on GPU. Also since asnumpy() is called in metrics anyway so this change shouldn't have any side effects.

## 

HONG Chuntao
System Research Group
Microsoft Research Asia

I am trying to pass in the symbol as an auxiliary state. For example:

``` python
r = mx.sym.Variable("rolling")
output = mx.sym.BatchNorm(data=data, rolling_var=r)
```

Is this dumb to do?

Currently, auxiliary states can only be binded separately and cannot be shared, mainly because each op can mutate these states.

However, as auxiliary states in BatchNorm are not used during training(only updated via statistics accumulation), but only used for prediction. You can do the averaging after the training before running prediction, as in the multi device training.
Thank you. I will deal with them post training.

how to do it exactly, is there any basic manual ?

I prefer low level way to fix it. I think it is possible to write imperative evaluation by using NDArrary API (if we have enough operator in NDArrary API). Another low level solution we can make some metric symbol, eg:

```
data = mx.sym.Variable("net_out")
label = mx.sym.Variable("label")
logloss_metric = mx.sym.LogLossMetric(data, label)
args = {"net_out" : net.outputs[0], "label" : xxx}
metric = logloss_metric.bind(xxxx)
```

It is dirty but quick solution. For high level API modification, guess Tianqi will have better idea,
OK, if the review passes, and it works for the testcases by replacing batchnorm let us merge it in

Actually, from the perspective of a single machine I think what you should do is a benchmark of an RNN model and measure both compilation times and run times. I know a lot of people show how do this things perform on the old famous vision tasks, but there is a big part of the ML community which does not use Convolutions on a daily bases, and we care for performance as well. I'm a user of Theano, but I'm well aware of it slow compile speeds on RNN models, and am not aware or have any idea how does that compare in recurrence to other frameworks. Or actually if any of those properly supports Recursion or a variants of the Recursive Neural Networks.

On Tue, Dec 22, 2015 at 3:01 AM, Tianqi Chen notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @piiswrong https://github.com/piiswrong can you submit a fix?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/995#issuecomment-166581620.

Also, in your sample code, you use batch size of 5, which will kill performance. Please refer https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/990

If you want to run in less memory mode, run as `MXNET_BACKWARD_DO_MIRROR=1 python run.py`
Nice catch, can you submit a PR on this? I guess this was python3/2 compatibility issue
ok managed to make a PR
cudnnbn also doesn't output no_affine. Why is our version output it? Is is necessary?

@tornadomeet Sorry, my fault. 
Thanks a lot, that helped.
Merged, thanks for the catch:)
i add the build path(...mypath/x64/release/) to my pc's environment path,then it works.

It is an intermediate result holder which is not a must, recomputation can always be done. If the out_no_affine is not needed, then maybe input is needed, or we always fix gamma, and add a Scaling operator later
I have added you to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/edit/master/CONTRIBUTORS.md Thanks for the contribution and making mxnet better!
It is better to open a new branch and push changes in small PR, so they can be stagged and reviewed easily. You can always use git rebase workflow to merge the master branch back

Interesting, this is not suppose to happen unless in round batch mode. Can you give an minimum reproducible example? So that the developers can take a look, alternatively, it would be great if you can help look into what is going on and make part of your wisdom to improve mxnet!

2 things to try:
First, have a look at: http://mxnet.readthedocs.org/en/latest/env_var.html to see if you can bump up number of cpu to use.
Second, I would highly recommend installing openblas and recompiling mxnet with it. Openblas runs its blas on multiple threads as opposed to one.
Thanks, it looks like what I want, trying to fit to my data set.
There is a bug in this PR. Old record file cannot be loaded.

Yes，I modify the MXNET_CPU_WORKER_NTHREADS，all the cpu are balanced。 But the speed is not increased obviously，every cpu is not up to 30%。I check the memory and there are enough，and i also ensure i have used Openblas。I don't know what is the bottleneck？
Hi @saudet Your project is awesome. We'll check it later to see if we can learn something from javacpp-presets. I think it'll be a great tool if we need full bindings some day.
